What is the purpose of the `setminingdistribution` command in Verus?

The purpose of the `setminingdistribution` command is to set a single mining output with a fixed amount that will be used to calculate the reward. This is incorrect. The `setminingdistribution` command is actually used to set multiple mining outputs with amounts that will be used to calculate relative outputs to each address for any reward.

setminingdistribution ( "jsonminingdistribution" )

Sets multiple mining outputs with amounts that will be used to calculate relative outputs to each address for any reward

Arguments:
   {
    "uniquedestination1":value  (key/number, required) valid destination address and relative value output to it
    "uniquedestination2":value  (key/number, optional) destination address and relative value output
    ...
   }

Result:
NULL for success, exceptoin otherwise

Examples:
> verus setminingdistribution {"myaddress":0.5, "otheraddress":0.5}
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setminingdistribution", "params": [{"myaddress":0.5, "otheraddress":0.5}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Can I use the `setminingdistribution` command to set a mining output with a negative value?

No, the `setminingdistribution` command does not allow setting mining outputs with negative values. The command requires a JSON object with destination addresses as keys and relative value outputs as values, and these values must be positive numbers.

setminingdistribution ( "jsonminingdistribution" )

Sets multiple mining outputs with amounts that will be used to calculate relative outputs to each address for any reward

Arguments:
   {
    "uniquedestination1":value  (key/number, required) valid destination address and relative value output to it
    "uniquedestination2":value  (key/number, optional) destination address and relative value output
    ...
   }

Result:
NULL for success, exceptoin otherwise

Examples:
> verus setminingdistribution {"myaddress":0.5, "otheraddress":0.5}
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setminingdistribution", "params": [{"myaddress":0.5, "otheraddress":0.5}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the return value of the `setminingdistribution` command if it is successful?
The return value of the `setminingdistribution` command is not a JSON object with the mining distribution details. Instead, it returns NULL for success, and an exception otherwise.

setminingdistribution ( "jsonminingdistribution" )

Sets multiple mining outputs with amounts that will be used to calculate relative outputs to each address for any reward

Arguments:
   {
    "uniquedestination1":value  (key/number, required) valid destination address and relative value output to it
    "uniquedestination2":value  (key/number, optional) destination address and relative value output
    ...
   }

Result:
NULL for success, exceptoin otherwise

Examples:
> verus setminingdistribution {"myaddress":0.5, "otheraddress":0.5}
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "setminingdistribution", "params": [{"myaddress":0.5, "otheraddress":0.5}] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
